last_post.content:
The Computer Emergency Response Team of Ukraine (CERT-UA) has linked a destructive malware attack targeting the country's national news agency (Ukrinform) to Sandworm Russian military hackers.

The threat actors launched the CaddyWiper data-wiping malware on the news agency's systems using a Windows group policy (GPO), showing that they had breached the target's network beforehand.

Still, the attack failed to impact the news agency's operations.

title: No-Show for Cosmic-Ray-Boosted, Lightweight Dark Matter

last_post.content:
In this nice analysis from Super-Kamiokande we use over 20 years of data to set limits on the interactions of very light dark matter coming from the direction of the galactic center.

It's a technically interesting analysis as we use protons moving fast enough to make Cherenkov light to find events and determine their direction (harder than our typical analyses that use electrons and muons).

The analysis was led by Linyan Wan at Boston Univ.

https://physics.aps.org/articles/v16/s11

title: How To Use Mastodon and the Fediverse: Basic Tips | Fedi.Tips – An Unofficial Guide to Mastodon and the Fediverse

last_post.content:
You can DM people on Mastodon by writing a post in "mentioned" visibility mode. In that mode, only accounts mentioned in the post can see it.

You can set post visibility by clicking on the visibility logo below the post:

🌎 - Public visibility, anyone can see it

🔓 - Unlisted, anyone can see it but not on main timelines

🔒 - Followers-only, your followers and anyone mentioned in the post can see it

@ - Mentions, only accounts mentioned can see it.

Find out more at https://fedi.tips/how-to-use-mastodon-and-the-fediverse-basic-tips/#WhoCanSeeMyPosts

last_post.content: "As Bill Gates tells the story, Warren Buffett once challenged him to a game of dice. Each would select one of four dice belonging to Buffett, and then they’d roll, with the higher number winning. These weren’t standard dice — they had a different assortment of numbers than the usual 1 through 6. Buffett offered to let Gates choose first, so he could pick the strongest die. In 1854, Abraham Lincoln wrote: "The legitimate object of government, is to do for a community of people, whatever they need to have done, but can not do, at all, or can not, so well do, for themselves—in their separate, and individual capacities.”

This seems very much in line with the "measure of collective intelligence" in the second paragraph of the Leonard/Levin paper quoted by @robin

Government as a means for fostering "collective intelligence?"

title: John Baez and James Dolan: math conversations

last_post.content:
Two hours a week I talk to James Dolan, mainly about algebraic geometry:

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLuAO-1XXEh0ZO-XC_uUYydL-qavIY3drK

I don't expect this to turn into a paper anytime soon, though I do hope to write one of my AMS Notice column about how the moduli space of triangles is connected to the moduli space of elliptic curves... an idea he came up with, probably not completely new.

One hour a week I talk to my last remaining grad student, Christian Williams. Logic and double categories!

(5/n)

lmao so many times i have had to change some setting in BIOS for one thing or another, and i've never been sure if it actually *does anything* besides enable troubleshooting to continue. it turns out, sometimes, it doesn't https://dawidpotocki.com/en/2023/01/13/msi-insecure-boot/

Now that the epidemiological modeling paper is done I'm spending 5 hours a week on Zoom.

Two hours a week I work with Joe Moeller and Todd Trimble on functors from the groupoid of finite sets to Vect, also known as 'linear species', and their connection to symmetric functions, representation theory, and characteristic classes. We're still waiting for our first paper on this stuff to get accepted:

https://arxiv.org/abs/2106.00190

but we're working on a second.

(4/n)

Want to try out Mastodon? Thinking about hosting your own? Or maybe you’re new to the experience and need some help or want tips for better connecting?  Our kind friends at Reclaim Hosting and ALT are doing a 90 day Mastodon experiment/class/seminar series where you can sign up for an account on a server that will self-destruct at the end of their trial run. They’re doing three sessions (live with recordings after), have a Discord for discussion and questions, and a Google doc with details and tips.

Session 2: Verifying your progress: 23 February 2023 at 16:00 GMT (Watch Live)

title: Pluralistic: Why the Fed wants to crush workers (19 Jan 2023) – Pluralistic: Daily links from Cory Doctorow

last_post.content:
The US Federal Reserve has two imperatives: keeping #employment high and #inflation low. But when these come into conflict - when unemployment goes zero-ish - the Fed forgets about #FullEmployment and cranks up #InterestRates to "cool the economy" (that is, "to destroy #jobs and increase #unemployment").

If you'd like an essay-formatted version of this thread to read or share, here's a link to it on pluralistic.net, my surveillance-free, ad-free, tracker-free blog:

https://pluralistic.net/2023/01/19/creditors-vs-workers/#finance-colored-glasses
